latestPosts.title: Deploying an app on AWS ECS with CDK
latestPosts.description: How to deploy an application on AWS ECS with load-balancing and auto-scaling using CDK by writing the CDK code in TypeScript

latestPosts.title: Testing Redux Connected React Components Using Jest
latestPosts.description: Testing React components connected to a Redux store using Jest and React Testing Library.

latestPosts.title: Running a Nuget Feed on S3 with Automated Deployments
latestPosts.description: There are many ways of creating a Nuget feed. but did you know that you can run a Nuget feed on S3 without any computing infrastructure? In this post, I will show you how you can create a Nuget feed on S3 using Sleet and automate the deployment process for packages.

latestPosts.title: Deploying a Website on S3 With SSL, Continuous Integration
latestPosts.description: In this post, I am creating a website and host it on S3 and setup a continuous integration pipeline setup using Gitlab

latestPosts.title: Creating a Re-Usable Presto Worker Image in EC2
latestPosts.description: Creating a machine image that can be used to spin up presto worker instances without configuring each one. this could be helpful when you don't want to use any  orchestration tool

latestPosts.title: React Form Validation Using Custom Hooks
latestPosts.description: Form validation in react is bit tricky. This is an attempt to make it bit easy by using react hooks. here we write few custom hooks to create a re-usable validation logic that can be used in any form.

latestPosts.title: Multiple Linear Regression With Python
latestPosts.description: Regression is a machine learning model which we can use to predict values by using previously observed data. In simple linear regression, we had to use only one independent variable for the prediction. but in the real world often a dependent variable is dependent upon several variables.

latestPosts.title: Simple Linear Regression With R
latestPosts.description: Regression models are used to predict real values such as salary, spending, income. Simple linear regression is a model of regression which is used to identify the correlation between two variables and possibly predict the dependent variable by using the independent variable.This will enable us to establish a relationship between two attributes such as Income and Spending and we can use what we know about the relationship to forecast unobserved values.

latestPosts.title: The Essence of Machine Learning
latestPosts.description: Machine learning can significantly improve the performance of a system. This could be very beneficial for businesses or any other application. So if someone comes to you and suggest you a business idea that involves machine learning, how do you decide that a machine learning implementation is feasible with the particular idea?

latestPosts.title: Data Pre-Processing With R
latestPosts.description: Before feeding our dataSet into a machine learning algorithm it's absolutely necessary to pre-process the data where we should clean and re-shape our data to get the maximum performance from our machine learning models. In this post, I will go through a set of procedures which you can use to pre-process a data set.

allPosts.title: Running FFmpeg in AWS Lambda using NodeJS
allPosts.description: When you have a requirement to do something on video/ audio files, the tool of choice would be FFmpeg which is free and open source. In this post I go through a way you can setup FFmpeg in AWS Lambda.

allPosts.title: One Method, Different Implementations
allPosts.description: We can set Func<>s as properties, so people can call them just like methods, and we can change the function from the constructor according to the user's needs. in this example, I am creating a class which has few methods to download data, the user of the class can decide whether they should cache the results or not
allPosts.about: Changing implementation of methods of a class at runtime in C#

allPosts.title: A Service Gateway Using NodeJS
allPosts.description: In this post I am writing a simple and minimal service gateway using JavaScript and NodeJS which can handle authentication , authorization.
allPosts.about: Creating a service gateway (API gateway) using JavaScript and NodeJS

allPosts.title: Genie - An Efficient Way to Access Data
allPosts.description: Almost all the time we need a database to run our apps. most of the time, these databases are relational databases. as everyone knows we must use SQL to access these databases. writing an SQL query for every database call is a pain and no one does that these days. instead, we use something called ORMs (Object Relational Mappers). we can use an ORM to access databases without writing SQL or worrying about mapping relations to objects. there are a lot of ORM implementations for every popular language.
allPosts.about: Accessing data on a realational database using Genie

allPosts.title: Service Helper — Seamlessly Send Request in Angular
allPosts.description: When using Angular 2+ to build web stuff , we use services to get data from our back-end services. usually most of these service calls are HTTP requests. Angular provides the Http class to send HTTP request, this has built on the Observable API. When we send a request, it returns an Observable which can be used to use the response returned by the server.
allPosts.about: Creating a ServiceHelper class to send HTTP requests from Angular applications
